metadata.title: Investigating the Fungal and Physicochemical Parameters During the Fermentation of Plantain (Musa paradisiaca) Peels to Bioethanol
metadata.description: The growing reliance on fossil fuels has led to numerous environmental challenges and exacerbated climate change, underscoring the need for alternative, affordable, renewable, and eco-friendly bioenergy sources. This study examined the fungal and physicochemical parameters involved in the fermentation of bioethanol from plantain (Musa paradisiaca) peels in Bayelsa State, Nigeria. Musa paradisiaca peels were selected for this research due to their availability in large quantities as waste products in the region. The fermentation process was carried out in two setups: one using A. niger and the other using S. cerevisiae. Over a 12-day fermentation period, bioethanol was recovered via distillation on the 13th day. The fermentation process was closely monitored, with fungal and physicochemical parameters (temperature, pH, specific gravity, and alcohol content) analyzed using standard methods. Results indicated an increase in total fungal count from 3.1 × 10² to 3.5 × 10² CFU/mL from days 1 to 3, followed by a decrease from 3.5 × 10² to 0 CFU/mL from day 3 to the end of distillation for the setup fermented by Aspergillus niger. Similarly, the fungal count for the Saccharomyces cerevisiaesetup increased from 3.2 × 10² to 3.5 × 10² CFU/mL from days 1 to 3 and then decreased from 3.5 × 10² to 0 CFU/mL after distillation. Throughout the fermentation, the temperature rose from 25.00°C to 30.35°C, while the pH decreased from 5.50 to 3.85. Specific gravity decreased from 1.018 to 0.436, resulting in an increase in alcohol content from 1.50% to 45.00% for the Aspergillus niger setup and from 1.60% to 50.00% for the S. cerevisiae setup. This study demonstrates that bioethanol can be effectively produced from Musa paradisiaca peels using A. niger and S. cerevisiae as fermenting agents.

metadata.title: Morgan Unified Field Theory (MUFT): From Fundamental Operator to Engineered Mass and Gravity
metadata.description:
Morgan Unified Field Theory (MUFT) rigorously establishes mass as the quantum operator sum over multiple gauge-field energies. This theory unifies quantum mechanics and gravitation into a consistent, operational framework with clear engineering pathways for controlling mass and gravity at laboratory and celestial scales. The paper contains detailed mathematical derivations, experimental protocols, error analysis, and comprehensive appendices with worked examples and application blueprints. 

Rigorous mathematical foundations with precise operator-sum formulas

Detailed empirical validation matching known physics

Clear novel, falsifiable predictions and protocols

Extensive engineering applications across aerospace, energy, medicine, and metrology

Thorough statistical analysis and error propagation methods

Fully developed worked examples and advanced experiment protocols

Complete appendices covering derivations, scalable blueprints, and comparative analyses

Well-structured references, glossary, flowcharts, and indexes

Explicit discussion of future work and limitations ensuring transparency

Ethical, safety, and open science compliance.

metadata.title: The THEORY OF EVERYTHING — A Thermodynamic View of Gravity and Universe La TEORIA DEL TUTTO — Una visione termodinamica della gravità e dell'universo
metadata.description:
Abstract (English)
We propose an operational, unifying framework: the Universe coincides with its own
energy surplus (U = ΔE), and that surplus inevitably decreases in time (ẊΔE < 0). Any
system dissipates through multiple channels and, at each instant, allocates power across the
compatible ones, prioritizing the **lowest effective energetic impedance**; as a channel
**saturates**, allocation **shifts** to the next cheapest path. Within this lens, gravity is not
a separate engine but an ordinary **routing channel**: it dominates when redistributing
mass along geodesics is the least-cost way to reduce ΔE, and it yields whenever other
channels (radiation, drag, tides, chemical/EM) become cheaper. Newtonian gravity and
General Relativity appear as limiting cases of the gravity-dominated regime, while coupled
dissipative processes explain orbital decay, tidal heating, radiation, and impact outcomes.
The framework is falsifiable: a single isolated system with ΔE > 0 and zero power outflow
would refute it. Practically, mapping channels and their **effective impedances** provides a
systematic strategy to optimize processes (cut losses, recycle by-products, maximize the
work channel). In short: a simple energetic grammar, fully compatible with known physics,
that ties together phenomena from the quantum scale to the cosmos.

Abstract (Italiano)
Questo lavoro propone una cornice unificante e operativa: l’Universo coincide con il proprio
surplus energetico (U = ΔE) e quel surplus decresce inevitabilmente nel tempo (ẊΔE < 0).
Ogni sistema dissipa attraverso canali multipli e **ripartisce la potenza** tra quelli
compatibili, privilegiando l’**impedenza energetica effettiva** più bassa; man mano che un
canale **si satura**, l’allocazione **si sposta** sui successivi più economici. In questo
quadro la gravità non è un motore separato, ma un canale di **instradamento**: domina
quando ridisporre la massa lungo geodetiche è il modo meno costoso per ridurre ΔE; cede il
passo quando altri canali (radiazione, attriti, maree, chimica/EM) diventano più economici.
Newton e la Relatività Generale emergono come casi particolari del regime gravitàdominante, 

mentre i processi dissipativi accoppiati spiegano il decadimento orbitale, il
riscaldamento mareale, l’irraggiamento e gli esiti d’impatto. Il quadro è falsificabile: basta
un sistema isolato con ΔE > 0 e nessuna potenza in uscita per confutarlo. Sul piano pratico,
mappare i canali e le loro **impedenze effettive** fornisce una strategia sistematica per
ottimizzare i processi (ridurre perdite, riciclare residui, massimizzare il canale-lavoro). In
sintesi: una grammatica energetica semplice, compatibile con la fisica nota, capace di
collegare fenomeni dal quantistico al cosmologico.

metadata.title: From Einstein's Dream to C3 Geometry: A Quantum-Compatible Unification of Gravity and Electromagnetism
metadata.description:
Abstract
Einstein devoted the later part of his life to the search for a unified field theory of gravity and electromagnetism. His approaches, based on classical differential geometry and higher-dimensional extensions, remained incomplete due to their incompatibility with quantum mechanics and the appearance of additional scalar degrees of freedom.

In this work, we propose a novel framework where unification is achieved not through extra spacetime dimensions but by an internal phase bundle built on the ternary algebra C₃ with j³ = −1. The construction yields a U(1) gauge field as the connection of the C₃ fiber, reproducing Maxwell theory without invoking a fifth dimension. A j-Hermitian inner product provides a positive-definite probability density and ensures unitary time evolution, resolving the quantum inconsistency of Einstein’s classical program.

The fate of the scalar ϕ is clarified: it can be removed by gauge fixing or promoted to a physical field with potential cosmological implications. The Lorentz force law emerges from the worldline action with a Berry-phase interpretation of electric charge, allowing for topological charge quantization. While the C₃ structure naturally generates electromagnetism, extensions to Cₙ fibers and circulant automorphisms open paths toward non-Abelian gauge groups such as SU(2) and SU(3), suggesting a possible geometric origin of the Standard Model.

We also discuss phenomenological signatures in multi-slit and Ramsey interferometry, Berry-phase shifts in superconducting loops, and potential cosmological corrections. This framework therefore not only fulfills Einstein’s original goal but also provides a quantum-consistent foundation with prospects for a more complete unification.

metadata.title: A New Field Equation for Physics: Superseding Einstein with Morgan's Field Equation
metadata.description:
This paper introduces a revised gravitational field equation for physics where mass is redefined electromagnetically, using Morgan’s law:

m = q² / (4π ε₀ c² r)

By substituting this relation into the Einstein field equation, the new model establishes gravity as an emergent property of electromagnetic fields rather than purely classical mass-energy. The implications extend to cosmology, unified field theory, technology, and experimental physics.

Methodology:

Substitute Morgan’s law as the source term for mass in all stress-energy tensors Tμν

Analyze resulting spacetime curvature and field equations

Discuss experimental and computational validation strategies

Outline consequences for cosmology, engineering, and quantum physics

 

Potential Applications:

 

Novel propulsion and field manipulation systems

New approaches to quantum gravity

Cosmological modeling

Precision gravimetry and lensing experiments

Advanced energy and information technology

metadata.title: Entropy-Originated Topological Framework for a Unified Theory of Matter and Gravity
metadata.description: We propose an entropic–topological projection framework that unifies matter and gravity within a single conceptual structure. The central object is a diagram Hilbert space, from which physical sectors are selected via projective operators constrained by topological invariants and entropic consistency conditions. This dual projection mechanism simultaneously generates particle masses through effective symmetry reduction and yields emergent gravitational dynamics as an entropic force. Renormalization group (RG) flows of gauge couplings indicate a natural tendency toward convergence, modified by entropic–topological corrections that stabilize unification without requiring fine-tuned thresholds. The framework embeds quantum chromodynamics (QCD) and the Standard Model (SM), provides space for neutrino physics, and suggests distinct experimental signatures such as proton decay, neutrinoless double beta decay, and cosmological imprints. The novelty lies in achieving unification through projection, rather than introducing exotic new fields.

metadata.title: Entropic Projection in the Diagram Hilbert Space: Mass Generation, Emergent Gravity, and Phenomenology
metadata.description: We propose a unifying framework based on entropic projection in the diagram Hilbert space to address open questions in the Standard Model and quantum chromodynamics, including the origin of fermion masses, the role of flavor structure, and the absence of a consistent quantum description of gravity. In this construction, Feynman-like diagrams are elevated to basis states of a Hilbert space, and physical dynamics emerge through projection operators defined by entropic principles. The dual outcome of this mechanism is twofold: effective particle masses arise from spectral properties of the projection, while gravity appears as an emergent thermodynamic response of the complementary channel. We further analyze the renormalization group flow modified by entropic–topological contributions and demonstrate conditions under which gauge couplings converge toward unification. Phenomenological consequences include predictive structures for neutrino masses, CP violation, dark matter candidates, and proton decay signatures. The framework is consistent with effective field theory expectations and opens a pathway to a renormalizable and testable extension of the Standard Model. The paper is structured to provide formal developments, renormalization group analysis, and phenomenological predictions, supported by appendices containing detailed proofs and computational methods.

metadata.title: INTRODUCTION TO THE QUANTUM THEORY OF ELECTROGRAVITATION
metadata.description:
*This update was necessary because the previous one contained an error in the description of equation 8.11; it stated that E-/- was negative, when obviously it is positive.

 

PART 1

In the first chapter, the "conversion factors" are introduced, which are dimensionless coefficients used to evaluate the effect of accelerated expansion of spacetime on measurements. It is shown that these factors can be expressed through a common parameter, α, the fine-structure constant, which is linked to the ratio between the theoretical radius (13.6-13.8 Gly) and the measured radius (46.5-47 Gly) of the universe. 

In the second chapter, it is demonstrated that dark matter and dark energy do not exist, and the gravitational effects attributed to them are actually caused solely by ordinary matter. 

In the third and fourth chapters, Newton's theory of gravitation is first extended into the generalized gravitational theory and then into the generalized electrogravitational theory. The latter, among other things, predicts the existence of electrogravitational waves, suggesting that photon and graviton are the same particle and that the graviphoton is constituted by two elementary electric charges of opposite sign. 

In the fifth chapter, Planck's law is derived from first principles. This implies that Planck's constant is no longer a fundamental constant but derivable from other constants. 

In the sixth chapter, the electrogravitodynamic equations and the electrogravitational stress-energy tensor are developed. 

In the seventh chapter, the quantization of Einstein's field equation is carried out. 

  

PART 2

In the eighth chapter, the possibility that elementary particles are in turn composed is examined and discussed: we have seen that the graviphoton corresponds to the elementary particle composed of two electric charges of opposite sign. 

In the ninth chapter, the mass ratio between proton and electron (approximately 1836) is calculated. 

In chapter ten, the concept of force is revised, as all particles can be exchanged, making them all carriers of force.   

In chapter eleven, the multiverse with repeated gravitational collapses (like a matryoshka) is introduced.  

In chapter twelve, the theory of information is integrated with the electrogravitational field: Information must be "contained" by something, whether it be a stone slab, a book, a CD, or any other means. This raises the question of whether there exists an ultimate level on which information can be encoded, the level of fundamental "0" and "1". This can only be spacetime itself (the electrogravitational field).

metadata.description:
Energy Phase in Cosmology (EPhiC) Ver21

I have reluctantly decided to restrict Ver20
I would greatly appreciate it if you could refer to Ver21 instead.

The reason is as follows:
While partially releasing the code under CC0, some concerns came to mind. I sincerely ask for your understanding.
I realized that Ver20 needed proper notices regarding the code.
Ver21 includes the necessary information for users.

Adjusting parameters, input sizes, or iteration counts to excessive values may lead to high CPU usage, memory shortages, or system instability.

Additional details are provided at the end of the PDF.

Unless there is a special reason, it seems that Ver.22 will serve as the final version.

Ver.21 includes a hypothetical explanation of the Moon’s satellite formation process.

 

---------------


I would like to introduce the essence of this work.

This theory presents a cosmological framework that expands the scale of the universe on the basis of hypothetical assumptions. It interprets the dynamics of energy—originating from Planck density and spreading across the universe—as the motion of vast, rotating energy fields.

The central focus of EPhiC is energy, phase, synchronization, and resonance. While some aspects of observable cosmic phenomena are addressed within EPhiC, I emphasize that this remains a hypothetical and exploratory approach, intended as a tentative attempt to search for possibilities.

Main themes of EPhiC:

1. EPhiC structure – energy source, energy field, and scale.


2. EPhiC and physical universe phenomena – galactic rotation, spiral arms, gravitational acceleration of black holes, and solar system resonances.


Keywords: energy, phase, resonance, dimension, cosmology, cosmic microwave background (CMB), energy field, rotating, time, light, gravity, dark matter, galactic rotation, spiral arm, solar system.

With Version 21, the content has reached its substantial conclusion.
Version 22 will be a final refinement and completion, though it may take considerable time to prepare.

Brief version overview:

Versions 1–17: fundamental theory and explanations.

Version 18: the theoretical framework was established.

From Version 19: nearly all content was rewritten, with solar system resonance newly modeled.

Version 21: additions included X–Y plane energy field dynamics, galactic rotation, spiral arms, and black hole gravitational acceleration. Concepts of time, light, and gravity were also revised to align more closely with the theory. A LaTeX formulation was added to describe solar system resonances.


Despite my efforts to reach a conclusive formulation, I acknowledge that there may still be shortcomings and errors. I sincerely ask for the readers’ generous understanding.

I am deeply grateful, as it is only through the patience and open-mindedness of readers that my first paper could develop to this stage.

Though modest and imperfect, I hope this work may still serve as a small seed of inspiration. May the happiness of the universe accompany you as you read this work.

 

I would like to express my sincere gratitude to Zenodo for its continued dedication and invaluable contribution to open science.  Thank you for your unwavering commitment and support.

I sincerely thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to review my email.

 

First of all, I sincerely apologize for any confusion caused due to my limited knowledge.

The discovery and theoretical development of the Cosmic Microwave Background (CMB) are truly remarkable, and I fully acknowledge and support these achievements.
